course.subject: CORE
course.name: Effective Chinese Communication
course.description: This course seeks to enhance the market competitiveness of HKUST graduates by making them effective users of spoken Putonghua and Standard Written Chinese in meeting communicative needs in academic, social and professional contexts. The course materials and activities help students acquire fluency and accuracy in the use of Chinese by engaging them in authentic communication tasks based  on  real-life situations and needs. Students’ mastery of Putonghua phonology and Chinese syntax and lexis will also be enhanced through in-class teaching and outside class practice.

reviews.author: kylan
reviews.comment_content:
this course talk alot about Multimedia communications
It delved into various aspects, including the integration of different media elements such as text, images, audio, video, and interactive elements. The course emphasized the importance of leveraging these elements to create effective and engaging communication strategies. Through in-depth discussions and practical examples, the course provided a comprehensive understanding of the principles and techniques behind multimedia communication. Overall, the course served as a valuable platform for exploring and mastering the intricacies of multimedia communication.
,The course emphasized accommodating different learning styles and employing storytelling techniques. Practical applications in today's digital world were highlighted. I highly recommend this course for enhancing communication skills.
reviews.comment_teaching: I had a rather positive experience with the course and found the teacher to be quite competent. Their knowledge and teaching style were effective in delivering the course material. Overall, I would say the teacher was satisfactory in providing a valuable learning experience.
reviews.comment_grading: I was pleased with the grading system employed in the course. The grading criteria were fair and transparent, allowing for a clear understanding of how performance was evaluated. The instructor provided constructive feedback that helped me improve my skills. Overall, I found the grading to be satisfactory and conducive to my learning progress.
reviews.comment_workload: Indeed, the outcome of the grading in the multimedia communication course largely depends on the effort and dedication that students put into their work. By investing substantial effort and working diligently, it is possible to achieve high grades. The course provides ample opportunities for growth and improvement, and those who demonstrate a strong work ethic and actively engage with the course material are more likely to excel and receive favorable grades.

reviews.author: Bellooo
reviews.comment_content:
Apparantly I am in this course since I got a 3 in DSE. I actually do not know what happened in lesson, maybe that's why I got a 3 in DSE since I never know what happens in Chinese lessons.

Anyways, we were tested on a presentation in a group of 5 about a new technology, thus a group discussion on a news within 1 year, then two passage, one of them is to decribe inspired you or learnt in the group project and elaborate it, while the second passage is to talk about your views in one of the two topics given by the instructor.
reviews.comment_teaching:
She is able to answer my questions and provide us examples for the tests, but the other partsI actually not very sure what she is talking about, e.g. different types of ways to proof something(?) really no idea.
No attendance is counted towards the grade but she did mark down who came for lessons, thus language is a subjective thing, which may (or may not) affect your grade with very low attandance
reviews.comment_grading:
There were 5% for quizzes (all or nothing), 5% for peer review, and the 90% splitted for the 4 things I mentioned.
I got mostly competent and a bit competent/advance I guess, end up with a B-, not sure if that is fair or not but whatever I never have to face Chinese again, at least it is not a C that ruins my grade. But I guess it is not those nice grade subs for you to get a high GPA (or maybe I am just too bad at it idk who cares).
reviews.comment_workload: Really depends whether you put effort on the writing and group project, but I think it is similar to core 1403 in my pov.

reviews.author: abcd830
reviews.comment_content:
The course objective is to let you learn more on argumentative essays and expository essays, also to improve your mandarin speaking level.
However, I would say the content is pretty vague,I don't really know what I have learnt from this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching from my professor is great, she is nice and willing to answer your questions in class or by email. However, as I mentioned before, the content is pretty bad, so it is what it is.
reviews.comment_grading: I think I did fair but I got a C+ in the end......
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is pretty average, some quizzes which you just make sure it is not a 0 and it is ok.

Then you have two essays, one group presentation and one group discussion which contribute about 80% of your total grade. So make sure you take your time on it and consult the professor if you want good grade.
